member.name: T:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.ACL

member.summary:

A list of updates being applied to the ACL.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.ACL.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
Indicates ACL status. Can be "creating", "active", "modifying", "deleting".

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.ACL.UserNames
member.summary:

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PasswordCount.
The number of passwords belonging to the user. The maximum is two.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Authentication.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
Indicates whether the user requires a password to authenticate.

member.name: T:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.AuthenticationMode

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.AuthenticationMode.Passwords
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Passwords.
The password(s) used for authentication

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.AuthenticationMode.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
Indicates whether the user requires a password to authenticate. All newly-created users require a password.

member.name: T:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Cluster
member.summary: Contains all of the attributes of a specific cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Cluster.ACLName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ACLName.
The name of the Access Control List associated with this cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Cluster.ARN
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ARN.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Cluster.AutoMinorVersionUpgrade
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AutoMinorVersionUpgrade.
When set to true, the cluster will automatically receive minor engine version upgrades after launch.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Cluster.AvailabilityMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AvailabilityMode.
Indicates if the cluster has a Multi-AZ configuration (multiaz) or not (singleaz).

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Cluster.ClusterEndpoint
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClusterEndpoint.
The cluster's configuration endpoint

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Cluster.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A description of the cluster

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Cluster.EnginePatchVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnginePatchVersion.
The Redis engine patch version used by the cluster

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Cluster.EngineVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EngineVersion.
The Redis engine version used by the cluster

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Cluster.KmsKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsKeyId.
The ID of the KMS key used to encrypt the cluster

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Cluster.MaintenanceWindow
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaintenanceWindow.
Specifies the weekly time range during which maintenance on the cluster is performed. It is specified as a range in the format ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi (24H Clock UTC). The minimum maintenance window is a 60 minute period.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Cluster.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The user-supplied name of the cluster. This identifier is a unique key that identifies a cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Cluster.NodeType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NodeType.
The cluster's node type

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Cluster.NumberOfShards
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NumberOfShards.
The number of shards in the cluster

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Cluster.ParameterGroupName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ParameterGroupName.
The name of the parameter group used by the cluster

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Cluster.ParameterGroupStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ParameterGroupStatus.
The status of the parameter group used by the cluster, for example 'active' or 'applying'.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Cluster.PendingUpdates
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PendingUpdates.
A group of settings that are currently being applied.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Cluster.SecurityGroups
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecurityGroups.
A list of security groups used by the cluster

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Cluster.Shards
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Shards.
A list of shards that are members of the cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Cluster.SnapshotRetentionLimit
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SnapshotRetentionLimit.
The number of days for which MemoryDB retains automatic snapshots before deleting them. For example, if you set SnapshotRetentionLimit to 5, a snapshot that was taken today is retained for 5 days before being deleted.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Cluster.SnapshotWindow
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SnapshotWindow.
The daily time range (in UTC) during which MemoryDB begins taking a daily snapshot of your shard. Example: 05:00-09:00 If you do not specify this parameter, MemoryDB automatically chooses an appropriate time range.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Cluster.SnsTopicArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SnsTopicArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS notification topic

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Cluster.SnsTopicStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SnsTopicStatus.
The SNS topic must be in Active status to receive notifications

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Cluster.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the cluster. For example, Available, Updating, Creating.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Cluster.SubnetGroupName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SubnetGroupName.
The name of the subnet group used by the cluster

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Cluster.TLSEnabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TLSEnabled.
A flag to indicate if In-transit encryption is enabled

member.summary:

Specifies the weekly time range during which maintenance on the cluster is performed. It is specified as a range in the format ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi (24H Clock UTC). The minimum maintenance window is a 60 minute period.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.CreateClusterRequest.NodeType
member.summary:

The compute and memory capacity of the nodes in the cluster.

member.summary:

The number of shards the cluster will contain. The default value is 1.

member.summary:

A list of Amazon Resource Names (ARN) that uniquely identify the RDB snapshot files stored in Amazon S3. The snapshot files are used to populate the new cluster. The Amazon S3 object name in the ARN cannot contain any commas.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.CreateClusterRequest.SnapshotName
member.summary:

The name of a snapshot from which to restore data into the new cluster. The snapshot status changes to restoring while the new cluster is being created.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.CreateClusterRequest.SnapshotRetentionLimit
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SnapshotRetentionLimit.
The number of days for which MemoryDB retains automatic snapshots before deleting them. For example, if you set SnapshotRetentionLimit to 5, a snapshot that was taken today is retained for 5 days before being deleted.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.CreateClusterRequest.SnapshotWindow
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SnapshotWindow.
The daily time range (in UTC) during which MemoryDB begins taking a daily snapshot of your shard.
Example: 05:00-09:00
If you do not specify this parameter, MemoryDB automatically chooses an appropriate time range.

member.name: T:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.ListAllowedNodeTypeUpdatesRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListAllowedNodeTypeUpdates operation. Lists all available node types that you can scale to from your cluster's current node type. When you use the UpdateCluster operation to scale your cluster, the value of the NodeType parameter must be one of the node types returned by this operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.ListAllowedNodeTypeUpdatesRequest.ClusterName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClusterName.
The name of the cluster you want to scale. MemoryDB uses the cluster name to identify the current node type being used by this cluster, and from that to create a list of node types you can scale up to.

member.name: T:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.ListAllowedNodeTypeUpdatesResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListAllowedNodeTypeUpdates operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.ListAllowedNodeTypeUpdatesResponse.ScaleDownNodeTypes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ScaleDownNodeTypes.
A list node types which you can use to scale down your cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.ListAllowedNodeTypeUpdatesResponse.ScaleUpNodeTypes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ScaleUpNodeTypes.
A list node types which you can use to scale up your cluster.

member.name: T:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.ListTagsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListTags operation. Lists all tags currently on a named resource. A tag is a key-value pair where the key and value are case-sensitive. You can use tags to categorize and track your MemoryDB resources. For more information, see Tagging your MemoryDB resources

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.ListTagsRequest.ResourceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource for which you want the list of tags

member.name: T:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.ListTagsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListTags operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.ListTagsResponse.TagList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TagList.
A list of tags as key-value pairs.

member.name: T:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Node
member.summary: Represents an individual node within a cluster. Each node runs its own instance of the cluster's protocol-compliant caching software.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Node.AvailabilityZone
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AvailabilityZone.
The Availability Zone in which the node resides

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Node.CreateTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreateTime.
The date and time when the node was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Node.Endpoint
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Endpoint.
The hostname for connecting to this node.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Node.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The node identifier. A node name is a numeric identifier (0001, 0002, etc.). The combination of cluster name, shard name and node name uniquely identifies every node used in a customer's Amazon account.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.Node.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the service update on the node

member.name: T:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.ResetParameterGroupRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ResetParameterGroup operation. Modifies the parameters of a parameter group to the engine or system default value. You can reset specific parameters by submitting a list of parameter names. To reset the entire parameter group, specify the AllParameters and ParameterGroupName parameters.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.ResetParameterGroupRequest.AllParameters
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AllParameters.
If true, all parameters in the parameter group are reset to their default values. If false, only the parameters listed by ParameterNames are reset to their default values.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.ResetParameterGroupRequest.ParameterGroupName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ParameterGroupName.
The name of the parameter group to reset.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.ResetParameterGroupRequest.ParameterNames
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ParameterNames.
An array of parameter names to reset to their default values. If AllParameters is true, do not use ParameterNames. If AllParameters is false, you must specify the name of at least one parameter to reset.

member.summary: This is the response object from the ResetParameterGroup operation.

The parameter group being reset.

member.summary: A tag that can be added to an MemoryDB resource. Tags are composed of a Key/Value pair. You can use tags to categorize and track all your MemoryDB resources. When you add or remove tags on clusters, those actions will be replicated to all nodes in the cluster. A tag with a null Value is permitted. For more information, see Tagging your MemoryDB resources

member.name: T:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.TagResourceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the TagResource operation. A tag is a key-value pair where the key and value are case-sensitive. You can use tags to categorize and track all your MemoryDB resources. When you add or remove tags on clusters, those actions will be replicated to all nodes in the cluster. For more information, see Resource-level permissions.
For example, you can use cost-allocation tags to your MemoryDB resources, Amazon generates a cost allocation report as a comma-separated value (CSV) file with your usage and costs aggregated by your tags. You can apply tags that represent business categories (such as cost centers, application names, or owners) to organize your costs across multiple services. For more information, see Using Cost Allocation Tags.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.TagResourceRequest.ResourceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to which the tags are to be added

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.TagResourceRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A list of tags to be added to this resource. A tag is a key-value pair. A tag key must be accompanied by a tag value, although null is accepted.

member.name: T:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.TagResourceResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the TagResource operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.TagResourceResponse.TagList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TagList.
A list of tags as key-value pairs.

member.name: T:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.UpdateClusterRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UpdateCluster operation. Modifies the settings for a cluster. You can use this operation to change one or more cluster configuration settings by specifying the settings and the new values.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.UpdateClusterRequest.ACLName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ACLName.
The Access Control List that is associated with the cluster

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.UpdateClusterRequest.ClusterName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClusterName.
The name of the cluster to update

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.UpdateClusterRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
The description of the cluster to update

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.UpdateClusterRequest.EngineVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EngineVersion.
The upgraded version of the engine to be run on the nodes. You can upgrade to a newer engine version, but you cannot downgrade to an earlier engine version. If you want to use an earlier engine version, you must delete the existing cluster and create it anew with the earlier engine version.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.UpdateClusterRequest.MaintenanceWindow
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaintenanceWindow.
The maintenance window to update

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.UpdateClusterRequest.NodeType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NodeType.
A valid node type that you want to scale this cluster up or down to.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.UpdateClusterRequest.ParameterGroupName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ParameterGroupName.
The name of the parameter group to update

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.UpdateClusterRequest.ReplicaConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplicaConfiguration.
The number of replicas that will reside in each shard

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.UpdateClusterRequest.SecurityGroupIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecurityGroupIds.
The SecurityGroupIds to update

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.UpdateClusterRequest.ShardConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ShardConfiguration.
The number of shards in the cluster

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.UpdateClusterRequest.SnapshotRetentionLimit
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SnapshotRetentionLimit.
The number of days for which MemoryDB retains automatic cluster snapshots before deleting them. For example, if you set SnapshotRetentionLimit to 5, a snapshot that was taken today is retained for 5 days before being deleted.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.UpdateClusterRequest.SnapshotWindow
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SnapshotWindow.
The daily time range (in UTC) during which MemoryDB begins taking a daily snapshot of your cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.UpdateClusterRequest.SnsTopicArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SnsTopicArn.
The SNS topic ARN to update

member.name: P:Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.UpdateClusterRequest.SnsTopicStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SnsTopicStatus.
The status of the Amazon SNS notification topic. Notifications are sent only if the status is active.

member.name: T:Amazon.MemoryDB.AmazonMemoryDBClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing MemoryDB
MemoryDB for Redis is a fully managed, Redis-compatible, in-memory database that delivers ultra-fast performance and Multi-AZ durability for modern applications built using microservices architectures. MemoryDB stores the entire database in-memory, enabling low latency and high throughput data access. It is compatible with Redis, a popular open source data store, enabling you to leverage Redis flexible and friendly data structures, APIs, and commands.

member.name: M:Amazon.MemoryDB.AmazonMemoryDBClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonMemoryDBClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.MemoryDB.AmazonMemoryDBClient.TagResource(Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.TagResourceRequest)
member.summary:
A tag is a key-value pair where the key and value are case-sensitive. You can use tags to categorize and track all your MemoryDB resources. When you add or remove tags on clusters, those actions will be replicated to all nodes in the cluster. For more information, see Resource-level permissions.
For example, you can use cost-allocation tags to your MemoryDB resources, Amazon generates a cost allocation report as a comma-separated value (CSV) file with your usage and costs aggregated by your tags. You can apply tags that represent business categories (such as cost centers, application names, or owners) to organize your costs across multiple services. For more information, see Using Cost Allocation Tags.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the TagResource service method.
member.returns: The response from the TagResource service method, as returned by MemoryDB.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for TagResource Operation

For example, you can use cost-allocation tags to your MemoryDB resources, Amazon generates a cost allocation report as a comma-separated value (CSV) file with your usage and costs aggregated by your tags. You can apply tags that represent business categories (such as cost centers, application names, or owners) to organize your costs across multiple services. For more information, see Using Cost Allocation Tags.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the TagResource service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the TagResource service method, as returned by MemoryDB.

member.name: T:Amazon.MemoryDB.IAmazonMemoryDB
member.summary:
Interface for accessing MemoryDB
MemoryDB for Redis is a fully managed, Redis-compatible, in-memory database that delivers ultra-fast performance and Multi-AZ durability for modern applications built using microservices architectures. MemoryDB stores the entire database in-memory, enabling low latency and high throughput data access. It is compatible with Redis, a popular open source data store, enabling you to leverage Redis flexible and friendly data structures, APIs, and commands.

member.name: M:Amazon.MemoryDB.IAmazonMemoryDB.CreateSubnetGroup(Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.CreateSubnetGroupRequest)
member.summary: Creates a subnet group. A subnet group is a collection of subnets (typically private) that you can designate for your clusters running in an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) environment. When you create a cluster in an Amazon VPC, you must specify a subnet group. MemoryDB uses that subnet group to choose a subnet and IP addresses within that subnet to associate with your nodes. For more information, see Subnets and subnet groups.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateSubnetGroup service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateSubnetGroup service method, as returned by MemoryDB.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateSubnetGroup Operation

member.summary: Creates a subnet group. A subnet group is a collection of subnets (typically private) that you can designate for your clusters running in an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) environment. When you create a cluster in an Amazon VPC, you must specify a subnet group. MemoryDB uses that subnet group to choose a subnet and IP addresses within that subnet to associate with your nodes. For more information, see Subnets and subnet groups.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateSubnetGroup service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the CreateSubnetGroup service method, as returned by MemoryDB.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateSubnetGroup Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.MemoryDB.IAmazonMemoryDB.TagResource(Amazon.MemoryDB.Model.TagResourceRequest)
member.summary:
A tag is a key-value pair where the key and value are case-sensitive. You can use tags to categorize and track all your MemoryDB resources. When you add or remove tags on clusters, those actions will be replicated to all nodes in the cluster. For more information, see Resource-level permissions.
For example, you can use cost-allocation tags to your MemoryDB resources, Amazon generates a cost allocation report as a comma-separated value (CSV) file with your usage and costs aggregated by your tags. You can apply tags that represent business categories (such as cost centers, application names, or owners) to organize your costs across multiple services. For more information, see Using Cost Allocation Tags.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the TagResource service method.
member.returns: The response from the TagResource service method, as returned by MemoryDB.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for TagResource Operation

For example, you can use cost-allocation tags to your MemoryDB resources, Amazon generates a cost allocation report as a comma-separated value (CSV) file with your usage and costs aggregated by your tags. You can apply tags that represent business categories (such as cost centers, application names, or owners) to organize your costs across multiple services. For more information, see Using Cost Allocation Tags.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the TagResource service method.
